intro: Weinmannia humblotii var. anceps, commonly known as the Huế weinmannia, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the tropical forests of Vietnam. It belongs to the family Cunoniaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and distinctive inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are usually ovate to elliptical in shape, with a glossy surface and serrated margins. The species is of significant botanical interest due to its limited distribution and unique morphological features.
